remarks: Lemma for ~ 2reu5 .  Note that ` E! x e. A E! y e. B ph ` does not mean "there is exactly one ` x ` in ` A ` and exactly one ` y ` in ` B ` such that ` ph ` holds;" see comment for ~ 2eu5 .  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-Jun-2017.)
statement:
2reu5lem1 $p |- ( E! x e. A E! y e. B ph <-> E! x E! y ( x e. A /\ y e. B /\ ph ) ) $.
$d A y $.
$d B x $.
$d x y $.
